declarations.description: An **accordion** is an interactive container that expands and collapses to hide or reveal nested content. It takes advantage of progressive disclosure to help reduce page scrolling, by allowing users to choose whether they want to show or hide more detailed information as needed.
declarations.name: PfAccordion

slots.description: Place the `pf-accordion-header` and `pf-accordion-panel` elements here.

members.name: single
members.description: When true, only one accordion panel may be expanded at a time

members.name: bordered
members.description: Whether to apply the `bordered` style variant

members.name: large
members.description: Whether to apply the `large` style variant

members.name: expandedIndex
members.description:
Sets and reflects the currently expanded accordion 0-based indexes.
Use commas to separate multiple indexes.
```html
<pf-accordion expanded-index="1,2">
...
</pf-accordion>
```

members.name: #init
members.description:
Initialize the accordion by connecting headers and panels
with aria controls and labels; set up the default disclosure
state if not set by the author; and check the URL for default
open

members.name: expand

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: index (0-based) of the panel to expand

members.description:
Accepts a 0-based index value (integer) for the set of accordion items to expand.
Accepts an optional parent accordion to search for headers and panels.

members.name: collapse

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: index (0-based) of the panel to collapse

members.description: Accepts a 0-based index value (integer) for the set of accordion items to collapse.

members.name: toggle

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: index (0-based) of the panel to toggle

members.description: Accepts a 0-based index value (integer) for the set of accordion items to expand or collapse.

members.name: expandAll
members.description: Expands all accordion items.

members.name: collapseAll
members.description: Collapses all accordion items.

events.description: when a panel expands
events.name: expand

events.description: when a panel collapses
events.name: collapse

attributes.name: single
attributes.description: When true, only one accordion panel may be expanded at a time

attributes.name: bordered
attributes.description: Whether to apply the `bordered` style variant

attributes.name: large
attributes.description: Whether to apply the `large` style variant

attributes.name: expanded-index
attributes.description:
Sets and reflects the currently expanded accordion 0-based indexes.
Use commas to separate multiple indexes.
```html
<pf-accordion expanded-index="1,2">
  ...
</pf-accordion>
```

declarations.description: The **back to top** component is a shortcut that allows users to quickly navigate to the top of a lengthy content page.

slots.description: Contains the prefix icon to display before the link or button.
slots.name: icon

slots.description: Text to display inside the link or button.

members.name: icon
members.description: Shorthand for the `icon` slot, the value is icon name

members.name: iconSet
members.description: Icon set for the `icon` property

members.name: alwaysVisible
members.description: Flag to always show back to top button, defaults to false.

members.name: scrollableSelector
members.description: Element selector to spy on for scrolling. Not passing a selector defaults to spying on window scroll events

members.name: scrollDistance
members.description: Distance from the top of the scrollable element to trigger the visibility of the back to top button

members.name: label
members.description: Accessible name for the back-to-top link, use when component does not have slotted text

members.name: href
members.description: Page fragment link to target element, must include hash ex: #top

declarations.description: A **badge** is used to annotate other information like a label or an object name.
declarations.name: PfBadge

members.name: state
members.description:
Denotes the state-of-affairs this badge represents
Options include read and unread

members.name: number
members.description:
Sets a numeric value for a badge.

You can pair it with `threshold` attribute to add a `+` sign
if the number exceeds the threshold value.

members.name: threshold
members.description:
Sets a threshold for the numeric value and adds `+` sign if
the numeric value exceeds the threshold value.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description:
Denotes the state-of-affairs this badge represents
Options include read and unread

attributes.name: number
attributes.description:
Sets a numeric value for a badge.

You can pair it with `threshold` attribute to add a `+` sign
if the number exceeds the threshold value.

attributes.name: threshold
attributes.description:
Sets a threshold for the numeric value and adds `+` sign if
the numeric value exceeds the threshold value.

declarations.description:
A banner is a 1-line, full color, full width container that can be used to communicate short snippets of information to users.
Banners are un-intrusive and non-dismissible.
declarations.name: PfBanner

slots.description: Contains the labels's icon, e.g. web-icon-alert-success.

members.name: #slots
members.description: Represents the state of the anonymous and icon slots

attributes.description: Changes the visual appearance of the banner.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Shorthand for the `icon` slot, the value is icon name

declarations.summary: Allows users to display a stylized banner.

declarations.description:
A **button** is a box area or text that communicates and triggers user actions when
clicked or selected. Buttons can be used to communicate and immediately trigger
actions a user can take in an application, like submitting a form, canceling a
process, or creating a new object. Buttons can also be used to take a user to a
new location, like another page inside of a web application, or an external site
such as help or documentation..
declarations.name: PfButton

members.name: label
members.description: Accessible name for the button, use when the button does not have slotted text

members.name: value
members.description: Form value for the button

members.name: name
members.description: Form element name for the button

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the button

members.name: loading
members.description: Represents the state of a stateful button

members.name: size
members.description: Changes the size of the button.

members.name: warning
members.description: Not as urgent as danger

members.name: danger
members.description:
Use danger buttons for actions a user can take that are potentially
destructive or difficult/impossible to undo, like deleting or removing
user data.

members.name: plain
members.description: Applies plain styles

members.name: variant
members.description:
Changes the style of the button.
- Primary: Used for the most important call to action on a page. Try to
limit primary buttons to one per page.
- Secondary: Use secondary buttons for general actions on a page, that
dont require as much emphasis as primary button actions. For example,
you can use secondary buttons where there are multiple actions, like in
toolbars or data lists.
- Tertiary: Tertiary buttons are flexible and can be used as needed.

members.description: Store the URL Link

members.description: Redirecting the URL Link to new Tab

- Secondary: Use secondary buttons for general actions on a page, that
  dont require as much emphasis as primary button actions. For example,

declarations.description:
A **card** is a square or rectangular container that can contain any kind of content.
Cards symbolize units of information, and each one acts as an entry point for
users to access more details. For example, in dashboards and catalog views, cards
function as a preview of a detailed page. Cards may also be used in data displays
like card views, or for positioning content on a page.
declarations.name: PfCard

slots.description:
When included, defines the contents of a card. Card headers can contain images as well as
the title of a card and an actions menu represented by the right-aligned kebab.
In most cases, your card should include a header. The only exceptions are when cards being
used as a layout element to create a white background behind other content.
slots.name: header

slots.description:
Communicates the title of a card if it's not included in the header.
If a card will be utilized as a selectable and clickable card, the title needs to be made as a linked text to trigger action and indicate interaction.
slots.name: title

slots.description:
Body. Provides details about the item. A card body can include any combination of static
text and/or active content.
Contains external links, actions, or static text at the bottom of a card.
slots.name: footer

members.name: size
members.description:
Optionally provide a size for the card and the card contents.
The default is set to `undefined` and provides default styles.
Compact provides styles which decreases the padding between the sections.
Large provides styles which increases the padding between the sections and the font size for the title, header, and footer.

members.name: rounded
members.description: Optionally apply a border radius for the drop shadow and/or border.

members.name: fullHeight
members.description: Optionally allow the card to take up the full height of the parent element.

members.name: plain
members.description: Optionally remove the border on the card container.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
Optionally provide a size for the card and the card contents.
The default is set to `undefined` and provides default styles.
Compact provides styles which decreases the padding between the sections.
Large provides styles which increases the padding between the sections and the font size for the title, header, and footer.

attributes.name: rounded
attributes.description: Optionally apply a border radius for the drop shadow and/or border.

attributes.name: full-height
attributes.description: Optionally allow the card to take up the full height of the parent element.

attributes.name: plain
attributes.description: Optionally remove the border on the card container.

declarations.summary: Gives a preview of information in a small layout

declarations.description: A **chip group** is a collection of chips that can be grouped by category and used to represent one or more values assigned to a single attribute. When value of numChips is exceeded, additional chips will be hidden using an overflow chip.
declarations.name: PfChipGroup

members.description: Set number of chips to show before overflow

declarations.description:
A **dropdown** presents a menu of actions or links in a constrained space that will trigger a
process or navigate to a new location.

members.description: handles a change event from a dropdown item

members.description: handles slot change event

members.name: #onMenuitemFocusin
members.description:
handles focusing on an option:
updates roving tabindex and active descendant

members.name: #onMenuitemClick
members.description:
handles clicking on a menuitem:
which selects an item by default
or toggles selection if multiselectable

declarations.description:
An **icon** component is a container that allows for icons of varying dimensions to
seamlessly replace each other without shifting surrounding content.
declarations.name: PfIcon

members.description: Removes all added icon sets and resets resolve function

members.description: Gets a renderable icon. Override this to customize how icons are resolved.

parameters.description: The name of the icon set
parameters.name: set

members.name: set
members.description: Icon set

members.name: icon
members.description: Icon name

members.name: size
members.description: Size of the icon

members.name: loading
members.description:
Controls how eager the element will be to load the icon data
- `eager`: eagerly load the icon, blocking the main thread
- `idle`: wait for the browser to attain an idle state before loading
- `lazy` (default): wait for the element to enter the viewport before loading

members.name: content
members.description: Icon content. Any value that lit can render

declarations.summary: Allows users to display meta data in a stylized form.

members.description: The trigger element which triggered the modal to open
members.name: trigger

declarations.description:
A **modal** displays important information to a user without requiring them to navigate
to a new page.
declarations.name: PfModal

cssProperties.description: Max width of the small variant modal
cssProperties.name: --pf-c-modal-box--m-sm--sm--MaxWidth

cssProperties.description: Max width of the small variant modal
cssProperties.name: --pf-c-modal-box--m-md--MaxWidth

cssProperties.description: Max width of the large variant modal
cssProperties.name: --pf-c-modal-box--m-lg--lg--MaxWidth

cssProperties.description: default font family for header-slotted headings
cssProperties.name: --pf-c-modal-box__title--FontFamily

cssParts.description: The modal overlay which lies under the dialog and above the page body
cssParts.name: overlay

cssParts.description: The container for the dialog content
cssParts.name: content

cssParts.description: The container for the optional dialog header
cssParts.name: header

cssParts.description: The container for the optional dialog description in the header
cssParts.name: description

slots.description: The default slot can contain any type of content. When the header is not present this unnamed slot appear at the top of the modal window (to the left of the close button). Otherwise it will appear beneath the header.
The header is an optional slot that appears at the top of the modal window. It should be a header tag (h2-h6).
slots.name: header

slots.description: Optional footer content. Good place to put action buttons.
slots.name: footer

members.name: closeOnOutsideClick
members.description: Should the dialog close when user clicks outside the dialog?

members.name: variant
members.description:
The `variant` controls the width of the modal.
There are three options: `small`, `medium` and `large`. The default is `large`.

members.name: position
members.description: `position="top"` aligns the dialog with the top of the page

members.name: trigger
members.description: Optional ID of the trigger element

members.name: toggle
members.description:
Manually toggles the modal.
```js
modal.toggle();
```

members.name: show
members.description:
Manually opens the modal.
```js
modal.open();
```

members.name: close
members.description:
Manually closes the modal.
```js
modal.close();
```

events.description: Fires when a user clicks on the trigger or manually opens a modal.
events.name: open

events.description: Fires when either a user clicks on either the close button or the overlay or manually closes a modal.
events.name: close

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The `variant` controls the width of the modal.
There are three options: `small`, `medium` and `large`. The default is `large`.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: `position="top"` aligns the dialog with the top of the page

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: Optional ID of the trigger element

declarations.summary: Displays information or helps a user focus on a task

declarations.description:
The **panel** component is a container that supports flexible content layouts. It can
be used to house other components such as fields, forms, videos, buttons, and more.
The panel should not be confused with the [drawer](https://www.patternfly.org/v4/components/drawer/design-guidelines/)
component, which allows you to surface information via a collapsable container.
declarations.name: PfPanel

slots.description: Place header content here
slots.name: header

slots.description: Place main content here
Place footer content here
slots.name: footer

declarations.description: A **Popover** displays content in a non-modal dialog and adds contextual information or provides resources via text and links.
declarations.name: PfPopover

cssProperties.description: Padding between close button and its immediate sibling
cssProperties.name: --pf-c-popover--c-button--sibling--PaddingRight

cssParts.description: The header element; only visible if both an icon annd heading are provided.
cssParts.name: header

cssParts.description: The container for the body content
cssParts.name: body

cssParts.description: The container for the footer content
cssParts.name: footer

slots.description:
The default slot holds invoking element.
Typically this would be an icon, button, or other small sized element.

This slot renders the content that will be displayed inside of the header of the popover.
Typically this would be a heading element.
slots.name: heading

slots.description:
This slot renders the icon that will be displayed inside the header of the popover,
before the heading.
slots.name: icon

slots.description: This slot renders the content that will be displayed inside of the body of the popover.
slots.name: body

slots.description: This slot renders the content that will be displayed inside of the footer of the popover.
slots.name: footer

members.name: alertIcons
members.default:
new Map(Object.entries({
    default: 'bell',
    info: 'circle-info',
    success: 'circle-check',
    warning: 'triangle-exclamation',
    danger: 'circle-exclamation',
  } satisfies Record<AlertSeverity, string>) as [AlertSeverity, string][])

declarations.description:
A select list enables users to select one or more items from a list.

A select component consists of a toggle control to open and close a menu of actions or links.
Selects differ from dropdowns in that they persist selection,
whereas dropdowns are typically used to present a list of actions or links.
declarations.name: PfSelect

slots.description: insert `pf-option` and/or `pf-option-groups` here
placeholder text for the select. Overrides the `placeholder` attribute.
slots.name: placeholder

Indicates initial popover position.
There are 6 options: `bottom`, `top`, `top-start`, `top-end`, `bottom-start`, `bottom-end`.
Default is `bottom`.

declarations.description:
A **spinner** is used to indicate to users that an action is in progress. For actions
that may take a long time, use a progress bar instead.

declarations.description:
A **switch** toggles the state of a setting (between on and off). Switches and
checkboxes can often be used interchangeably, but the switch provides a more
explicit, visible representation on a setting.

declarations.description: **Tabs** allow users to navigate between views within the same page or context.
declarations.name: PfTabs

slots.description: Must contain one or more `<pf-tab>`
slots.name: tab

slots.description: Must contain one or more `<pf-panel>`

members.name: labelScrollLeft
members.description: Aria Label for the left scroll button

members.name: labelScrollRight
members.description: Aria Label for the right scroll button

members.name: box
members.description: Box styling on tabs. Defaults to null

members.name: vertical
members.description: Set to true to enable vertical tab styling.

members.name: fill
members.description: Set to true to enable filled tab styling.

members.name: borderBottom
members.description: Border bottom tab styling on tabs. To remove the bottom border, set this prop to false.

members.name: manual
members.description:
Set's the tabs to be manually activated. This means that the tabs will not automatically select
unless a user clicks on them or uses the keyboard space or enter key to select them.  Roving
tabindex will still update allowing user to keyboard navigate through the tabs with arrow keys.

members.name: activeIndex
members.description: The index of the active tab

members.name: #tabs

declarations.description: A **text area** component is used for entering a paragraph of text that is longer than one line.
declarations.name: PfTextArea

members.name: accessibleLabel
members.description: Accessible label for the input when no `<label>` element is provided.

members.name: validated
members.description:
Value to indicate if the input is modified to show that validation state.
If set to success, input will be modified to indicate valid state.
If set to warning,  input will be modified to indicate warning state.
Invalid inputs will display an error state

members.name: disabled
members.description: Flag to show if the input is disabled.

members.name: required
members.description: Flag to show if the text area is required.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Flag to show if the input is read only.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Input placeholder.

members.name: value
members.description: Value of the input.

members.name: resize
members.description: Sets the orientation to limit the resize to

members.name: autoResize
members.description: Flag to modify height based on contents.

declarations.description:
A **tile** component is a form of selection that can be used in place of a
radio button and is commonly used in forms. A tile appears visually similar to a
[selectable card](../card/). However, tiles are used specifically when the user is selecting
a static option, whereas a selectable card triggers an action or opens a quickstart
or sidebar to provide additional information.
declarations.name: PfTile

slots.description: Icon expects a `<pf-icon>` or `<svg>`

slots.description: the title of the tile should be a heading
slots.name: title

slots.description: The content should be a paragraph

declarations.description: A **timestamp** provides consistent formats for displaying date and time values.
declarations.name: PfTimestamp

declarations.description:
A **tooltip** is in-app messaging used to identify elements on a page with short,
clarifying text.
declarations.name: PfTooltip

slots.description:
This slot wraps around the element that should be used to invoke the tooltip content to display.
Typically this would be an icon, button, or other small sized element.

This slot renders the content that will be displayed inside of the tooltip.
Typically this would include a string of text without any additional elements.
This element is wrapped with a div inside of the component to give it the stylings and background colors.
slots.name: content

members.name: position
members.description: The position of the tooltip, relative to the invoking content

members.name: content
members.description: Tooltip content. Overridden by the content slot

members.name: noFlip
members.description: If false, prevents the tooltip from trying to remain in view by flipping itself when necessary

members.name: flipBehavior
members.description:
The flip order when flip is enabled and the initial position is not possible.
There are 12 options: `top`, `bottom`, `left`, `right`, `top-start`, `top-end`,
`bottom-start`, `bottom-end`, `left-start`, `left-end`,`right-start`, `right-end`.
The default is [oppositePlacement], where only the opposite placement is tried.

members.name: #float
#invokerChanged
members.description: the invoker slot should render at block level if it only has text nodes

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: The position of the tooltip, relative to the invoking content

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: Tooltip content. Overridden by the content slot

attributes.name: no-flip
attributes.description: If false, prevents the tooltip from trying to remain in view by flipping itself when necessary

attributes.name: flip-behavior
attributes.description:
The flip order when flip is enabled and the initial position is not possible.
There are 12 options: `top`, `bottom`, `left`, `right`, `top-start`, `top-end`,
`bottom-start`, `bottom-end`, `left-start`, `left-end`,`right-start`, `right-end`.
The default is [oppositePlacement], where only the opposite placement is tried.

declarations.summary: Toggle the visibility of helpful or contextual information.
